about: International Study and Admission Consultancy (ISAC) is a premier education agency dedicated to guiding students toward higher education at top Italian universities. Founded by a team of engineering experts and university admission consultants, we specialize in diverse fields such as computer engineering, artificial intelligence, and civil engineering sectors. Our services include a comprehensive 5-month entrance exam preparation course taught by experienced engineers, visa guidance, scholarship assistance, mock interviews, and cultural orientation to ensure a smooth transition and a strong foundation for your engineering future in Italy.
whyItaly: Embark on a transformative journey in engineering education with Italy, a global leader in innovation and home to world-class universities. With tuition fees as low as €156 per year, English-taught programs, and a vibrant cultural landscape, Italy offers an unparalleled academic experience. Generous scholarships up to €8,000 make it accessible to aspiring engineers worldwide.
tolc_description: The entrance exam for engineering programs in Italy is an online test that can be taken from home, designed to assess readiness for Bachelor’s degrees in engineering, architecture, or related fields. It includes 50 multiple-choice questions and lasts 1 hour and 50 minutes, covering logic (10 questions), mathematics (20 questions), physics (10 questions), and chemistry (10 questions).
classes_description: International Study and Admission Consultancy (ISAC) delivers dynamic online training led by PhD-level engineering tutors with deep expertise in their fields. Our engaging formats include live Zoom sessions, recorded video lectures, and interactive group discussions, designed to prepare students for engineering programs in Italy. With a maximum of 15 students per class, we ensure personalized attention and tailored guidance to maximize learning outcomes.
syllabus_items: Logic: Develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills for complex challenges
Mathematics: Master algebra, calculus, and geometry for engineering applications
Physics: Explore mechanics, thermodynamics, and electromagnetism essentials
Chemistry: Learn materials science fundamentals for engineering innovation
General Knowledge: Stay updated on engineering trends and technological advancements

scholarships:
Italy offers a range of scholarships for international engineering students, providing financial support for Bachelor’s degrees in engineering, advanced technologies, architecture, or design. Merit-based scholarships provide up to €7,000–€8,000 per year, covering tuition fees and living expenses. Income-based scholarships offer similar amounts, including tuition waivers, accommodation, and meal support, with some reducing fees to as low as €156 per year. Additional full scholarships cover tuition, travel, and living costs for outstanding students.


Scholarships up to €8,000/year

Merit-based scholarships covering living expenses and tuition for exceptional students in engineering programs.

Course Fee Waivers up to €156/year

Income-based waivers reducing tuition fees to as low as €156/year. Sri Lankan students are eligible for these waivers.
visa: Non-EU international students need a Type D long-stay student visa for programs over 90 days. Required documents include: a valid passport (issued in the last 10 years, valid for at least 3 months after program end, with 2 blank pages); university acceptance letter; proof of financial means (€467.65 per month or €6,079.45 per year minimum); health insurance (covering at least €30,000); proof of accommodation in Italy; completed visa application form; recent passport photos; and payment of visa fee (€50-€80). Apply at the Italian embassy or consulate in your home country 3-6 months before departure. Upon arrival, apply for a residence permit within 8 days. For US residents, include US residence proof if applicable.
